title: Taiwan’s Semiconductor Dominance: Implications for Cross-Strait Relations and the Prospect of Forceful Unification
description: As tensions with China loom, what effect would a Chinese invasion of Taiwan have on a global economy dependent on Taiwanese microchip manufacturing?

title: A Shared Responsibility: Public-Private Cooperation for Cybersecurity
description: Federal action on cybersecurity is more likely than ever in 2022. This report provides recommendations for public-private collaboration on cybersecurity, based on the findings of two roundtables with senior information security executives and government officials.

title: U.S. Power and Influence in the Middle East: Part Three
description: Jon looks at how the United States has used its economic toolkit in the region, and how successful sanctions and development aid have been in advancing U.S. interests in the Middle East.

title: Spotlight on Civilian Harm in the Mariupol Theater Airstrike
description: A Russian airstrike destroyed the Mariupol Drama Theater on March 16, trapping hundreds of civilians who had taken refuge inside the building. Targeting of the theater is consistent with Russia’s pattern of attacking non-military objects and locations.

title: Predicting the Future
description: This week, the Scholl Chair makes predictions about the long-term implications of the war in Ukraine, the pandemic, and the challenge of China.

title: How Is China Expanding its Infrastructure to Project Power Along its Western Borders?
description: China is significantly enhancing its ability to project military power along its western borders through widescale construction and upgrading of airfields, roads, railways, and other strategic infrastructure.

title: Drought Hits the Horn of Africa
description: Against a backdrop of ongoing violence and political instability in the region, the worst drought in decades has hit the Horn of Africa. With millions of lives and livelihoods at stake, a lack of resources looms large and gives rise to fears of mass irregular migration.

title: Notes from a CSIS Virtual Event: Cybersecurity Considerations for Data Localization Regulation
description: On March 9, CSIS hosted an event on the necessary cybersecurity considerations for data localization efforts, featuring Peter Swire, DeBrae Kennedy-Mayo, Victoria Baines,  Andreas Mitrakas, and Raphael Marichez .

title: The Energy Weapon—Revisited
description: The term “energy weapon” is easily misused and often abused. A few weeks into the conflict in Ukraine, what can we say about the energy weapon?

title: One Year of Tanzanian President Hassan: What’s Changed?
description: It’s been one year since Samia Suluhu Hassan assumed the Tanzanian presidency following the unexpected death of autocrat John Magufuli. Marielle Harris outlines Hassan’s progress in five distinct policy areas.

title: The Latest on Southeast Asia: March 17, 2022
description: After two years of lockdown and numerous Covid-19 variants, Southeast Asian governments are beginning to shift their policies from treating Covid-19 as pandemic to endemic.

title: Agriculture and Food Security: Casualties of the War in Ukraine
description: The CSIS Global Food Security Program hosted Ukraine's deputy minister of agriculture for a discussion on the impacts of war on global food security.
